item.title: Python Basics
item.description: Expressions consist of values (such as 2) and operators (such as +), and they can always evaluate (that is, reduce) down to a single value. A single value with no operators is also considered an expression, though it evaluates only to itself, as shown here: 2 2 Table 1-1: Math Operators from Highest to Lowest Precedence Operator Operation Example Evaluates to . . . ** Exponent 2 ** 3 8
